RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Maiden Claiming Purse 52000. (UP TO $9,048 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIDE UP was unprepared while moving around at the start and last to commence while bumping with a foe, recovered quickly to stalk the pace on the outside, was given his cue in the three path midway through the turn, dropped to the two path outside the quarter-pole, came under a drive in upper stretch, took the lead outside the furlong marker, shook clear under a left-handed crop outside the sixteenth-pole then was placed under a mild hand-ride while drawing away to the finish. SIPPICAN SHOP was forced out at the start then bumped soundly with a foe, settled well off the pace under coaxing, was urged along in the two path early on the turn then angled five wide, continued five wide into the stretch, drifted in while remaining on his inside lead near the three-sixteenths, continued on his inside lead to the finish and safely secured the place. BARGAINING POWER disputed the pace on the outside of a foe while loosely between horses, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked near the five-sixteenths, dropped to the rail outside the quarter-pole, fought under a drive in upper stretch, lost the advantage outside the furlong marker and weakened then was overtaken for the place while well clear for the show. GOLDEN PURCHASE bumped with a rival at the start, checked when RIDE UP came in front behind the trees on the pan-camera view, settled on the outside, was urged four wide on the turn, moved out after turning into the stretch and failed to respond. MO THAN LUCK veered out at the start then was corrected by the rider, disputed the pace on the inside of a foe, chased along the rail on the turn, was driven three wide into the stretch and tired. ASSERTIVE ATTITUDE broke out and brushed the gate then was bumped soundly, was hard ridden while climbing some, moved from the rail to the three path on the turn and capitulated. I LOVE CARA bumped with a rival while dropping back after the start, fell well behind the rest of the field, went around the turn in the two path, came out into the stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Than Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out brk,corrected,pace ins foe,chsd rail turn,3p1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Sippican Shop
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out brk,bmpd,coaxed,2p7/16,angled 5w3/8,drift in3/16,up2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Assertive Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,brshd gate,bmpd soundly,hard ridden,ins-3p turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: I Love Cara
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd after brk,drop back,well behind,2p turn,came out1/4,trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Bargaining Power
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace outside foe,loosely btwn,2p,rail1/4,headed1/8,wknd,lost 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Purchase
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,checked early,settled out,4w turn,mvd out,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Ride Up
ENTRY.OWNER: Snyder Richard Snyder Connie Hoppel Jesse Setzer Brett and KEM Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepard brk,bmp,last away,stlkd out,3-2p turn,lead1/8,drew away

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Upson Downs Farm & Louis W. Wright

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 1M Inner turf CR: 97. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. INNER TURF (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTION AL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred )(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOT SO CLOSE lost some footing at the start and brushed with CHILI FLAG, established narrow command just off the inside into the first turn before tucking inside midway, showed the way in hand along the inside patiently handled until set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in and held well and safe to prevail kept to task. CHILI FLAG (FR) brushed at the start by NOT SO CLOSE who came inwards slightly, saved ground at the tail of the field, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, closed well to secure the place honors in the final jumps. SISTER LOU ANN tracked the pace along the inside, got let out spinning just off the inside into upper stretch in behind the leader and was denied a tip out straightened away as PLEASANT PASSAGE came in a path to deny the tip, got clearance a furlong from home and offered up a mild kick just missing for the place honors at the end. SAFFRON MOON a bit rank under restraint just off the inside early on, tracked just off the inside, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and angled five wide into upper stretch, ran on through to the finish but was out-finished in the late stages. PLEASANT PASSAGE three then two wide through the first turn, tracked the front just off the inside in closest aim, swung four wide into upper stretch and tucked quickly three wide to deny SISTER LOU ANN a tip out from in behind the leader straightened away, then came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Chili Flag (FR)
ENTRY.OWNER: Madaket Stables LLC Dubb Michael and Kisber Michael E
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed st, saved grd at rear, coaxed 5/16, 6w upper, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Lou Ann
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, let out 2w 1/4p, tip out 3p 1/8p, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Saffron Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit rank 2p early, tracked 2p, 5w upper, ran on, out-finished

ENTRY.NAME: Not So Close
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p early, in hand ins, set down 2w 1/4p, edged away, held well

ENTRY.NAME: Pleasant Passage
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w 1st turn, tracked 2p, 4-3w uppr, denied foe tip, empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 1 1/16M Turf CR: 95. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARRAGE bumped hard with a rival at the start, was rated inside under a snug hold, moved to the two path late on the far turn, brushed with a rival while swinging six wide into upper stretch, chased the leading duo into the final furlong, gained into the final sixteenth and got up under strong handling. ROUGH DRAFT was away awkwardly, went to the front, dropped from the two path to the rail on the first turn, showed the way down the backstretch, was asked while inside on the far turn, spun three wide into the stretch then came further out, dueled inside of CITIZEN K into the final sixteenth, fought on to the wire and narrowly beat the aforementioned foe for the place but was denied by the winner. CITIZEN K went around the first turn in the two path, stalked the pace on the outside, engaged the leader in the two path on the far turn, was given his cue at the five-sixteenths, took a short lead outside the quarter-pole, was carried four wide into the stretch then moved a bit further out, dueled outside of the runner-up into the final sixteenth, fought on to the finish and just missed while able to get the show. AGENT CREED made light contact with a foe after the start, dropped from the two path to the rail going around the first turn, was reserved off the pace, shifted from the rail to the three path on the final turn, was roused at the five-sixteenths, swung eight wide into upper stretch, chased into the final sixteenth and finished willingly for the last spot in the superfecta. FRANK'S ART came in just after the start then made light contact with an opponent, tucked into the two path under a hold for the run around the first turn, settled outside but with some cover on the backstretch, traveled two then three wide on the far turn, was roused at the five-sixteenths, brushed with a rival while coming seven wide into upper stretch, chased the vanguard to the finish and lacked the needed kick. FATIMA'S BLESSING shied in just after the start then was corrected with the right-rein, went around the first turn in the three path, was reserved near the back, traveled three then four wide on the far turn, was asked near the five-sixteenths, remained on his inside lead until near the sixteenth-pole then swapped to the proper lead and lacked the needed response. BATTLE SCARS bumped hard with a rival at the start then was taken up while in tight, saved ground at the rear, came under urging on the far turn and failed to rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Citizen K
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,stalked outside,bid2p2nd,lead1/4,4p,5p,dueled,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Barrage
ENTRY.OWNER: Palmer Teresa and Palmer David J
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd hard brk,rated inside,swung 6w1/4,brshd,rallied,up late

ENTRY.NAME: Battle Scars
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd hard brk,tkn up,saved ground,ask2nd turn,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Rough Draft
ENTRY.OWNER: Clear Stars Stable Mitre Box Stable and Big Toe Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward brk,2p-ins1st,pace,ins2nd,ask5/16,dueled,gamely,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Fatima's Blessing
ENTRY.COMMENT: shied in after brk,3p1st,reserved,3-4p2nd,failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Agent Creed
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump after brk,2p-ins1st,reserved,ins-3w2nd,8w3/16,chased

ENTRY.NAME: Frank's Art
ENTRY.COMMENT: came in brk,light bump,2p1st,settled out,2-3p2nd,7w3/16,chased

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 52000. (UP TO $9,048 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WATASHA broke out at the start and was corrected, chased three to four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command nearing the eighth pole and inched away under a drive kept busy to the finish. WESTERN GHENT coaxed from the gate, prompted the pace of CAMM' DUKE from the outside in the two path coming under coaxing at the three-eighths and advancing to press that rival through the latter portion of the turn, swung four to five wide into upper stretch taking over command straightened away, dug in and was displaced from command near the eighth pole and ran on to chase the winner home well clear of the rest to be along second best. DR. PERRY chased just off the inside patiently handled until set down angled four then three wide into upper stretch and weakened in the drive. V MART chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four to five wide into upper stretch, tired. CAMM' DUKE broke in at the start and brushed with the near side stall, showed the way in hand along the inside under pressure from WESTERN GHENT and coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch under threat, yielded the front straightened away and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Dr. Perry
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, set down 4-3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Camm' Duke
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, in hand ins, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, yielded, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Watasha
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 3-4w, coaxed 5/16, 6w uppr, up 1/8, inched clr

ENTRY.NAME: Western Ghent
ENTRY.OWNER: Ghent Bob Ghent Ann Lukas Laurie and Lukas D Wayne
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, prompted 2p, coaxed 3/8, 4-5w upper, ran on, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: V Mart
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 4-5w upper, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 83000. (UP TO $14,442 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (For Horses That Sold or RNA for $50,000 Or Less In Their Most Recent Sale).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLOWERS FOR ME was hustled from the gate, settled behind a foe early while towards the front, moved up when given more clearance to the inside around the nine-sixteenths, shifted from the rail to the two path on the turn, gained to take the lead in upper stretch, shook clear into the final furlong and prevailed under steady urging. GINUCCHA settled off the pace, gained four then five wide on the turn, chased outside into the final furlong and was out-kicked while able to get the place. ACCOMMODATE EVA bumped with a rival at the start, was ridden along on the outside, went five wide early on the turn then angled to the two path, moved out just behind the leader in upper stretch, chased while remaining on her inside lead to the finish and lacked the needed kick while able to get the show. MIZ MASTERY was urged along off the pace, dropped from the two path to the rail early on the turn, was asked for her best in upper stretch, chased into the final furlong and also lacked the needed kick. BOXED WINE bumped with a rival after the start, settled at the rear, went three then two wide on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. LESLIE'S LOOT tossed her head then came outward while breaking in the front half of the field, went to the front then quickly sped clear, dropped from the two path to the rail on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the advantage in upper stretch and tired. HAYES BAY was bumped at the start and forced into another foe then taken up while squeezed back, raced under urging towards the rear, went three wide on the turn, drifted out outside the furlong marker and was no factor. LA COLORADA was hustled from the gate then chased the pace, went three then four wide on the turn, floated seven wide into the stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Flowers for Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,settled early,urged4-1/2,mvd up,chsd ins-3p,lead3/16,clr

ENTRY.NAME: La Colorada
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,chased,3-4wide turn,floated 7w1/4,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Miz Mastery
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,2path-inside turn,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Ginuccha
ENTRY.OWNER: Cash is King LLC and LC Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,gained 4-5wide turn,chased,earned place

ENTRY.NAME: Leslie's Loot
ENTRY.OWNER: Chapman, James K. and Tsujimoto, Stuart
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head,came outward,sped clear,2p-ins turn,headed3/16,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Accommodate Eva
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,urged outside,5p7/16,2p3/8,mvd out3/16,no kick,earn3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Hayes Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd btwn brk,pinched,well back,3w turn,drift out 1/8,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Boxed Wine
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd after brk,at rear,3-2path turn,4p into lane,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Starter Allowance Purse 70000. (UP TO $12,180 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allow ed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUGAR GRAY LEONARD four wide in pursuit, remained patiently handled and was set down spinning five to six wide into upper stretch, rallied to take over command a furlong from home, edged clear under a drive to prevail. KING JAMES stumbled at the start, chased three paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four to five wide through the turn, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick to get up in the final jumps for the place honors. IGNITED bobbled at the break, pressed the pace three wide, got let out continuing three wide into upper stretch, took over brief command just inside the three-sixteenths, then got headed for the front a furlong out and ran on through to the finish getting collared late for the place honors while well clear of the rest for the show. LET FREEDOM SPRING hustled from the gate, chased six then five wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, went six to seven wide into upper stretch and weakened. BURN JAKEY BURN chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued along the inside into upper stretch, tired. FORWARD MOVE established the front and showed the way in hand just off the inside in hand, had the rider sneak a peek to his right side nearing the half mile pole, came under increased pressure through the turn from IGNITED, got placed to coaxing near the quarter pole and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, yielded the front just inside the three-sixteenths, the rider again peeking outwards to the right side, then got placed to a protective hold a furlong from home and was eased through to the finish. MAMA'S GOLD stumbled at the start, chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and tired. IMAGE OF QUALITY chased inside briefly before tipping to the two path, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung two to three wide into upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Image of Quality
ENTRY.OWNER: Pantofel Stable LLC Wachtel Stable and Barber Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside briefly, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Burn Jakey Burn
ENTRY.OWNER: Schrader Michael and St Elias Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 3/8, inside 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ignited
ENTRY.OWNER: Braverman Paul Pinch Timothy and Namcook Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, pressed 3w, let out 3w upper, led briefly, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Forward Move
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, under pressure turn,2w 1/4, yielded, protected, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Gray Leonard
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, set down 5-6w upper, up 1/8p, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Mama's Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: King James
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, 3w backstretch, 5-4w turn, 3-4w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Let Freedom Spring
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 6-5w, coaxed 5/16, 6-7w upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 1M Inner turf CR: 83. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. INNER TURF (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). ( Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TANGENTIAL was rated just off the pace on the inside, moved off the rail while asked late on the far turn then rallied three wide into the stretch, took over at the three-sixteenths, shook clear into the final furlong and held under steady urging. NO DELI (IRE) bumped with a rival at the start and had the rider lose his outside iron, regained the iron while drifting in early, was unhurried at the back while traveling around the turns in the two path, shifted four wide while asked at the quarter-pole then steadied behind horses, altered out for room inside the three-sixteenths, swapped leads back and forth in the vicinity of the furlong marker and finished with good energy for the place. MIRABELLA was taken in hand early, went three wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, was roused three wide on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch then moved further out and finished willingly for the show. SISTER MAHA broke in and bumped with a rival, went to the front, showed the way in the two path, was asked coming to the quarter-pole, lost the lead under a drive in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. ISOLA (IRE) became very rank under tight restraint on the initial straightaway, was taken up nearing the first turn then continued very rank in the two path around that bend, tugged hard at the bit until near the nine-sixteenths then leveled out, saved ground on the far turn, shifted three wide into the stretch then quickly tipped further out, raced between horses past the three-sixteenths, remained on her inside lead in the drive and lacked the needed response. NOTINAMILLIONYEARS (IRE) was fractious in the gate then taken in hand early, saved ground while reserved towards the rear, was put to a drive in upper stretch and failed to rally. MOM'S RIGHT was taken under a tight hold early then tucked into the two path, raced in the front half of the field while in hand, came under urging near the five-sixteenths, dropped back under a drive in upper stretch and lacked the needed kick. KICK A RHYME (IRE) was taken back early, went two then three wide on the first turn, settled well back in the field, was roused three wide on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch, drifted in near the sixteenth-pole and failed to threaten. FANCY STAX brushed the outside of the gate at the start then was hustled, tracked the pace on the outside in the three path, chased on the far turn, dropped back between horses in upper stretch and tired. BEL ROSSO broke in and was off a bit slow, went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside without cover, was roused four wide on the far turn, spun five wide while in a reasonable striking position into the stretch but came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Tangential
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside,ask3p1/4,took over outside1/8,responded,held driving

ENTRY.NAME: Kick a Rhyme (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back,2-3p1st,well back,ask3p2nd,5w1/4,mvd out,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Notinamillionyears (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,in hand,reserved inside,failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Maha
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,bmpd,to front,pace 2path,headed ins3/16,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Isola (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Calvert Chad RAP Racing and Grund David
ENTRY.COMMENT: very rank,stdying restraint,2p-ins,level1/2,3p1/4,mvd out,flatten

ENTRY.NAME: Mirabella
ENTRY.OWNER: Low, Lawana L. and Robert E.
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,3p1st,settled,ask3w2nd,4w1/4,mvd out,willingly for show

ENTRY.NAME: No Deli (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp brk,lost out iron brief,unhurried 2p,4p1/4,stdy,alter,rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Bel Rosso
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,bmpd,bit slow,4w1st,outside,ask4w2nd,5w1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Mom's Right
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold,2p1st,rated,2p2nd,asked 5/16,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Fancy Stax
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd gate,hustled,3p1st,tracked,chased 3p2nd,drp back3/16,wknd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 96. Starter Allowance Purse 70000. (UP TO $12,180 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allow ed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WIN FOR GOLD four wide in aim of the leader, advanced to duel four then three wide with PAY ZONE to his inside through the turn taking over narrow command inside the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, drew clear under a drive to prevail. GIROOVIN chased four to five wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, went six wide into upper stretch, kicked on belatedly to secure the place honors clear of the rest. KUNSHAN BRIDGE stumbled at the start recovering outwards and bumping PAY ZONE conceding two lengths to the front, chased just off the inside down the backstretch before tucking inside through the turn, remained on hold through the turn getting placed to hand urges by the rider near the quarter pole before being called upon in earnest at the three-sixteenths, tipped out from along the rail to the four path nearing the sixteenth marker, loosely split foes with seventy yards to go showing late interest to get up for the show honors in the final jumps while never threatening the top pair. BIG VENEZUELA got bumped at the start by PAY ZONE due to pressure from KUNSHAN BRIDGE, chased three wide coaxed along from the three-eighths, angled six to seven wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid to improve position to the finish. PAY ZONE got bumped at the start by KUNSHAN BRIDGE, who recovered outwards from a stumble and in turn bumped the aforementioned foe, showed the way in hand just off the inside early on before coming under pressure and then being engaged in head to head combat through the turn by WIN FOR GOLD, got displaced from the front and went three wide into upper stretch, then weakened in the drive. CLUBHOUSE chased three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung four then three wide into upper stretch, tired. THE COBBLER broke a half a beat slow and then got forced to steady off the heels of GIROOVIN when that rival took over his lane, conceded three lengths to the front, chased four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Kunshan Bridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased 2p, ins turn, ins 1/4, asked 3/16, interest

ENTRY.NAME: Pay Zone
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, in hand 2p, dueled turn, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Big Venezuela
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, angled 6-7w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Clubhouse
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, 4-3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Win for Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Ten Strike Racing Four Corners Racing Broadview Stables and Cory Moelis Racing L
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w in aim, dueled 4-3w turn, up ins 5/16, 4w upper, drew clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Sequel Stallions NY & StonestreetThoroughbred Holdings, LL

ENTRY.NAME: The Cobbler
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 slw, steadied st, chased 4w, coaxed 3/8, 7w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Giroovin
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4-5w, coaxed 7/16, 6w upper, belatedly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Rick Violette S. SARATOGA RACE 9 1 1/16M Turf CR: 90. Stakes Purse 125000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $125 each which should accompany the nomination; $625 to pass the entry box and an additional $625 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplement payment of $625 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to bed ivided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 123 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstakes in 2023 or two races on the turf other than maiden, claiming or starter a llowed 3 lbs.; of a race other than maiden, claiming or starter on the turf allowed 5 lbs. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the main track. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, Auggu
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LET'S GO BIG BLUE brushed with a rival at the start, was eased back while taken under a tighter hold nearing the first turn, traveled three wide around that bend, settled outside on the backstretch, was roused while three then four wide on the far turn, rallied five wide into the stretch, closed well to get the lead inside the three-sixteenths then was given one pop of a right-handed crop, drifted out about four paths when switched to a left-handed crop inside the furlong marker, carried out the runner-up in the process then was straightened by the rider approaching the sixteenth-pole, swapped back to his left lead inside that pole, fought tooth and nail with the unofficial runner-up to the wire and held gamely. RAMBLIN' WRECK was slowest into stride then asked to pick it up, saved ground on the first turn, settled at the rear, drafted in the two path early on the far turn then shifted to the four path late on that bend, rallied six wide into upper stretch, closed well to make a bid inside the furlong marker, was carried out by the unofficial winner at that juncture, fought outside that foe on even terms in the final sixteenth and was denied while well clear for the place. WILLINTORISKITALL bumped with a foe after the start then was taken up, went two then three wide on the first turn, was rated outside while tracking the pace, came under urging around the seven-sixteenths, went four then three wide on the far turn then was guided four wide into the stretch, chased while remaining on his inside lead to the furlong marker then swapped to the proper lead and weakened but just held the show. ITSALLCOMINTOGETHA brushed with an opponent at the start, was taken in hand early, rounded the first turn in the three then four path, prompted the pace on the outside, vied in the three path on the far turn, took the advantage coming to the five-sixteenths, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the lead inside the three-sixteenths and tired. KING OF COMEDY moved from the rail to the two path on the first turn, was rated in the second flight, traveled around the far turn in the two path while let out, shifted three wide at the quarter-pole then chased the leaders, dropped in near the furlong marker and also tired then missed the superfecta. VACATION DANCE was hustled from the gate then bumped with an opponent, went to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked on the far turn, lost the advantage coming to the five-sixteenths pole and faded. FOLLOWING THE RACE, THE STEWARDS' POSTED THE INQUIRY SIGN AND THE RIDER OF RAMBLIN' WRECK CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE UNOFFICIAL WINNER. AFTER THE STEWARDS' REVIEW, LET'S GO BIG BLUE WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM FIRST AND PLACED SECOND FOR INTERFERENCE OUTSIDE THE SIXTEENTH-POLE

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOCKE AND KEY lost his footing at the start, chased along the inside, tipped out three wide through the turn coming under coaxing nearing the quarter pole, swung five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive rallying to collar the embattled top pair a furlong from home, edged away under a drive to prevail. RUSSI coaxed from the start, showed the way narrowly three wide early on before dueling tucked inside through the turn with VAUNTED to his outside, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, got overthrown in tandem with his main pace rival a furlong out, fought on to secure the place honors on the wire. VAUNTED lost his footing at the start, raced four wide in close aim before advancing tucked to the two path to duel through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, got displaced in concert with the aforementioned foe by the top one at the eighth pole, battled on to the finish but was ultimately bested for the place honors while well clear for the show. PRINCE OF TRUTH six paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked four then three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung five wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. TWIRLING VINE chased along the inside, got out five to six wide through the turn uncorrected, went six to seven wide into upper stretch, made no impact. PASCHAL MOON hustled from the gate, chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went six wide into upper stretch and tired. SCREW LOOSE chased three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide for home and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Russi
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3p early, dueled ins turn, 2w 1/4p, fought on
